subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] those "pops" "rolling thunder" "snaps"  and "boom"
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0020_01C9D6D4.F74F25E0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

The have to learn to help themselves. The only thing you can do to help the=
m is tell them to move on.

A friend of mine lives in a haunted house. He h=
ears loud popping noises before the onset of activity.

I am thinking it is=
 the sound of the spirit manifesting on this plane. Kinda like breaking the=
 sound barrier, only this would be the dimensional barrier.

In my Stanley =
Hotel recording, I talked to you about, there is some very loud popping noi=
ses.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: James W. Hyslope 
  To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, May 17, 2009 12:27 AM
  Subject: [EVP-I=
TC] those "pops" "rolling thunder" "snaps" and "boom"





  One last quest=
ion before I got to bed after 1am :) What are those noises often heard befo=
re or after an EVP? I have found quite a few voices that I wouldn't have no=
ticed hadn't I first heard a "pop" sound. Actually had to do some MAJOR enh=
ancing on 2 of them to even hear them at all. I mean one was impossibly bur=
ied in the noise. But after slowing it down I got a "wiff" of it, and throu=
gh more passes of the Audacity effects I was rewarded with a female voice. =
It was sad though...she said in a mechanical pattern "can - you - help- me.=
........please - help. Still, the audio is so painfully low. Hearing her pl=
ea will forever effect me. Hopefully I can find someoneone here that can he=
ar them as well as I. That can verify this for me :) I hear it...but is nic=
e to know someone else is there with you :) I went back to that location li=
ttle over an hour later (after found the voice) Is under 1 mile from me. It=
's a real sad thing to hear and not knowing what to do.Jim H
